name: Vegan Mocha Mousse
description: The nuttiness of tofu provides a nice base for the rich chocolatiness and bitter edge of coffee in this mousse.  The flavors play nicely together, but definitely don't bother making this if you're not a fan of tofu—there's no mistaking it.
recipeIngredient: Two 12.3 ounce packages (or about 25 ounces total) firm silken tofu
3 tablespoons instant coffee or espresso powder
1/2 cup honey or grade B maple syrup

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the tofu into chunks and drain in a colander or on several layers of paper towels for about 10 minutes. Meanwhile, melt the chocolate in the microwave or over a double-boiler.
Purée the tofu in a blender or food processor (or use a stick blender) until creamy, about 1 minute. Make sure to scrape down the sides a couple of times.
Add the chocolate, cocoa, espresso powder, honey/syrup and vanilla; blend until well combined. Fold in the sea salt, if using.
Transfer to a large bowl (or individual serving bowls), cover, and chill 3-4 hours, or overnight.
